**Edited <time datetime="2016-06-27T07:53:52Z" title="06/27/2016 07:53  AM" data-short="8 yr">June 27, 2016</time> by FreeThinker**

Thanks for the SpaceDock info.  I dont know how I missed it there.

All is great now, cheers.

Another (hopefully helpful) comment regarding curse: could you post the kerbal.curseforge link ([http://kerbal.curseforge.com/projects/interstellar-fuel-switch?gameCategorySlug=ksp-mods&projectID=237233](http://kerbal.curseforge.com/projects/interstellar-fuel-switch?gameCategorySlug=ksp-mods&projectID=237233)) instead of the other one? I do not want to try which of the ten tracking scripts I have to allow to get to the download and I am sure that I am not the only one.

MOVED TO KSPI THREAD

**Edited <time datetime="2016-06-27T09:16:42Z" title="06/27/2016 09:16  AM" data-short="8 yr">June 27, 2016</time> by raxo2222**

[@raxo2222](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/110750-raxo2222/)

### 
The 6 IFS tanks actualy already exisit but they are located in KSPI-E. Perhaps would be an idea to transfer them (and all resourc  gathering related stuff) to IFS package. Technically it should be possible and would allow IFS to specialize more in universal resource storage and gathering 

Note that I explicitly mention Universal Resource gathering as we need some way to make the resource harvester switchable, similary you can do now for a tank, you switch resource gathing mode. This should allow you to create Surface/Ocear/Atmosphere resource gatherrers that can switch to a multitude of minable resources. It would also be able to switch storage resources at the sam time, similar to how texture switches which resource content. This will also reduce resource cluting and make it a bit more intuitive

I have IFS 2.0.9 and I was curios, as I am not 100% sure if this is a 1.1.3 or a IFS bug.  When I 'lock' a fuel tank, it doesn't stay locked when going from <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> to Launch.

> 
>

> 
>

When I 'lock' a fuel tank, it doesn't stay locked when going from <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr> to Launch.
> 

Perhaps it is IFS, could you create some screen dumps?

**Edited <time datetime="2016-06-27T15:13:01Z" title="06/27/2016 03:13  PM" data-short="8 yr">June 27, 2016</time> by FreeThinker**

Sure, I hope this help.  One image of the tanks, "locked" in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>.  I then clicked "save" and then "launch" , no longer locked.

[http://imgur.com/a/nOQ69](http://imgur.com/a/nOQ69)
I did go back to a previous version of IFS and the tanks are not staying locked.

> 
> 
> On 27-6-2016 at 11:23 PM, gamerscircle said:
> 
> 
> Sure, I hope this help.  One image of the tanks, "locked" in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr>.  I then clicked "save" and then "launch" , no longer locked.
> 
> 
> 
>

> 
> 
> 
> 
> [http://imgur.com/a/nOQ69](http://imgur.com/a/nOQ69)
> 

So, what is going wrong? The Resource type, amount and drymass is the same in both <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building"><abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr> as on the Launch pad. Everything seems right to me...

Edit: oh wait, it's the locked state that is the problem? I haven't changed anything about this, perhaps it a stock change ...

If not, it must have been part of IFS for a long time ...

Sorry I wasn't clear, yes - if I lock a fuel tank i the editor and then go to the launch pad, that tank is no longer locked.

~~Perhapds not because of ISFS, but how would one go about trouble-shooting why not a single tank contains oxidizer?~~ 

The culprit was  [ABZB IFS Integration Mod](http://spacedock.info/mod/230/Mk2%20Extended%20KSPI%20Integration).  Is there a good method of applying ISFS to KW Rocketry tanks?

Well I know what is happening. Simply put it replaced the resource and simply ignores/forgets about the lock state. I will try to look soon if I can fix it.
Ah.. okay, thank you - Sorry about that

## 
Version 2.1.0 <small>for Kerbal Space Program 1.1.3</small>

<small>Released on 2016-07-01</small>

- Flow mode is now preserved
- Initial tank selection now depends on initial resources on tank
- Added IFS to Xenon tank which preserves stock balance
- Re-balanced IFS demo tanks to preserve stock balance

>

[@FreeThinker](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/117389-freethinker/) - I just noticed a strange message in my log and tracked it down to this <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)"><abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr></abbr> script.

    [LOG 00:40:34.878] InsterstellarFuelSwitch SetupTankInPart adding resources: Stuctural;
    [WRN 00:40:34.879] Could not create PartResource of type 'Stuctural

Bug Report: The script mis-spells the word 'Structural' in the module section near the top (3 times)

I'm running IFS 2.1.0 straight outta <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr>. I hope this helps. I've fixed it in mine.

In case it was missed above, the script in question is IntegrateInterstellarFuelSwitch.cfg

**Edited <time datetime="2016-07-14T23:06:08Z" title="07/14/2016 11:06  PM" data-short="7 yr">July 14, 2016</time> by geekasylum**

## 
Version 2.1.1 <small>for Kerbal Space Program 1.1.3</small>

<small>Released on 2016-07-24</small>

- Added new property orderBySwitchName which if set true will order the tanks in alphabetical order
- Fixed misspelling of Structural in script

**Edited <time datetime="2016-07-24T00:19:10Z" title="07/24/2016 12:19  AM" data-short="7 yr">July 24, 2016</time> by FreeThinker**

Hi,  

I was just wondering while trying to build a <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>, why IFS doesn't allow Oxidizer-only tanks? Would be a great addition imo, instead of leaving half empty tanks every time.  

Thanks.

> 
> 
> On 24-7-2016 at 7:17 PM, Bamki said:
> 
> 
> Hi,  
>   
> 
> I was just wondering while trying to build a <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit"><abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr></abbr>, why IFS doesn't allow Oxidizer-only tanks? Would be a great addition imo, instead of leaving half empty tanks every time.  
>   
> 
> Thanks.
> 

Well, a combination of Liquid/Oxygen + Liquid Fuel should be enough in most cases

## 
Version 2.1.2 <small>for Kerbal Space Program 1.1.3</small>

<small>Released on 2016-07-28</small>

- Fixed issues where sorted tank list would receive wrong custom mass and custom cost
- When HasGui is true, it will stabilize the switch control when switching between tanks , making switching less cumbersome
- For all parts affected by IFS Stock Script, replaced Structural by Oxidizer
- For all parts affected by IFS Stock Script, sort tank in Alphabetical order
- For all parts affected by IFS Stock Script, enabled HasGui, stabilizing switching in <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>
